title: FALSE: Photo of Sarah Elago wearing NPA uniform
subtitle: The photo is manipulated. The guerrilla in the photo is not Kabataan Representative Sarah Elago.
author: rappler.com
vclaim:
The photo was shown in a video posted in 2018, which had the logo of "The Northern Pulse." It argued that Elago aims to overthrow the current administration. This video was posted by at least 4 other pages and accounts in 2018, and was being shared again in July 2020.

"Isa siya sa mga galamay at suportado ng founder ng mga Teroristang CPP-NPA-NDF na si Jose Maria Sison," read one frame of the video. (She is one of the tentacles and one of those supported by the founder of the terrorist CPP-NPA-NDF [National Democratic Front], Jose Maria Sison.)

A reverse image search showed that the original photo was published in an Associated Press report. The woman in the photo is not Elago, but a 24-year-old NPA guerrilla with the nom de guerre "Comrade Katryn." The photo was taken on November 23, 2016 by Aaron Favila.

The youth representative is often targeted by disinformation on social media. Rappler has debunked multiple manipulated and out-of-context photos that were used to link Elago to the CPP-NPA. – Loreben Tuquero/Rappler.com

Keep us aware of suspicious Facebook pages, groups, accounts, websites, articles, or photos in your network by contacting us at factcheck@rappler.com. Let us battle disinformation one Fact Check at a time.
